review: I went ahead and ordered one of these on a hunch that it would play files based on the fact that Google Chrome (the browser) is a pretty good media player in and of itself. I have tried this on both my PC and Mac with success.  Once you have installed the software as described in the instructions there will be a chromecast button on the top right of your browser all of the time.  Simply drag and drop the file that you want to play into the browser and when it starts playing go to full screen on your browser and you will have full audio and video on your TV

author: R.L.

review: First things first.  I love the idea of the chromecast.  However, there is one very HUGE drawback to it.  It does not actually stream content from your phone.  All your phone really is, is a remote control for it.  To do anything with it, you have to have a WIFI internet source (which CANNOT be your phone).  All the ads and literature imply that you are playing stuff from your phone.  Then you read the description of the package very closely and decipher the cleverly word description and find out that your phone merely controls it (i.e. your phone is an overpriced remote control for it).  Now if you have a good, high speed, unlimited data, wifi internet access, then these facts will not really matter to you.  This thing will work just fine for you then.  However, for much of Rural America, this is simply not an option.  Our phones out here ARE our internet access.  My phone has a good 4G connection and has an unlimited data plan, but without another good internet source, this device is rendered useless. You can't even stream videos and pictures that I have taken on your phone through it.
